brief_description: Using a systems biology approach to study innate and adaptive responses to influenza vaccination in humans during the 2008-2009 influenza season.
brief_title: Systems Biology of 2008 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (See companion studies SDY61 2007 / SDY270 2009 / SDY271 Role for CaMKIV in the Regulation of Antibody Responses to Influenza Vaccine)
description: Using a systems biology approach to study innate and adaptive responses to influenza vaccination in humans during the 2008-2009 influenza season.
endpoints: ELISA, ELISPOT, Gene expression, Flow Cytometry, HAI
hypothesis: Using a systems biology approach to study innate and adaptive responses to influenza vaccination in humans during the 2008-2009 influenza season. See companion studies for 2007 (SDY61) and 2009 influenza seasons.
objectives: Detailed characterization of the innate and adaptive responses to vaccination with TIV and LAIV to identify putative early signature with or predicted later immunogenicity in order to obtain new insight into the mechanisms underlying immunogenicity.
official_title: Systems Biology of 2008 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (See companion studies SDY61 2007 / SDY270 2009 / SDY271 Role for CaMKIV in the Regulation of Antibody Responses to Influenza Vaccine)

pubmed.title: Systems biology of vaccination for seasonal influenza in humans.
Systems Analysis of Immunity to Influenza Vaccination across Multiple Years and in Diverse Populations Reveals Shared Molecular Signatures.

program.contract_name: Systems Biological Analysis of Innate and Adaptive Responses to Vaccination

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
